definition: sutra/Taoist treatise
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing

sentences.english: This is the canon of Scripture.
Walking is the best timing for walking practice.
sentences.chinese: 走路是經行念真經最好的時機。

sentences.english: After eighty adventurous experiences, Tang Sanzang finally got the real Buddhist scripture.
sentences.chinese: 唐三藏曆經九九八十一難終於取得了真經。

sentences.english: Do you know when people recite the Sutra?
sentences.chinese: 你知道人們在什麼時候默唸真經？

sentences.english: Recite every word in every movement of exercising.
sentences.chinese: 換成五字真經，運動即修行。

sentences.english: However, to read 'no word Scriptures, you will not read it?
sentences.chinese: 但是要念‘無字真經，你會不會念呢？

sentences.english: Nine Yin true through, no matter where you are, I will be by your side.
sentences.chinese: 九陰真經，不管你在哪兒，我都會在你身邊。

definition: a Daoist talisman
Nāgārjuna (c. 150-250 AD), Buddhist philosopher
Nagarjuna (Nagarjuna Bodhisattva)
Healing sutra/Bhaisajyaguru sutra
(Buddhism) to initiate sb for monkhood or nunhood
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
to pass on the light of Buddha
virtuous achievements come to their successful conclusion (idiom)
to bid farewell/tricks of the trade/pithy mnemonic formula (e.g. Mao Zedong's 16-character mantra 十六字訣|十六字诀 on guerrilla warfare)
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
to pass on doctrines from master to disciple (Buddhism)
one who surmounts all obstacles (Buddhism)
to sit in meditation/to meditate
(of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest
the five impurities (Buddhism)
